title: RN Patient Care Manager
description:
The Home Health Patient Care Manager is responsible for the overall supervision and coordination of clinical services. Coordinates and supervises an interdisciplinary team of staff to assure the continuity of high quality care to home health patients assigned to the team's area in accordance with physician prescribed plan of care, and all applicable state and federal laws and regulations.

  

* Receives referrals and ensures appropriate clinician and/or therapist(s) assignments for timely patient evaluation by signing off after authorization and plotting start of care (SOC) visits.
* Coordinates determination of patient home health benefits, medical necessity, and ongoing insurance approvals.
* Ensures patient needs are continually assessed and care rendered is individualized to patient needs, appropriate and reasonable, meets home health eligibility criteria, and is in accordance to physician orders.
* Oversees and assures development, implementation, and updates to the individualized patient plan of care, as appropriate.
* Manages and documents phone calls from physicians, clinicians, patients, referral sources, and communicates patient updates/new orders to clinicians. Uses coordination notes to document, as needed and appropriate.
* Reviews assessments and plans of care daily, per assigned workflow, and consults clinicians with recommendations, as appropriate.
* Coordinates all aspects of care with all disciplines, physicians, durable medical equipment providers, caregivers/family members, transferring facilities, and any other applicable healthcare providers.
* Follows-up on lab and other clinical diagnostic test, physician contact, and significant changes in the patient condition to ensure adequate physician notification, follow-up, and needed plan of care modifications and communicates such to clinicians.
* Schedules, prepares for, facilitates, and documents case conference/SOC reports and facilitates effective exchange of information across disciplines especially with adverse findings, changes in patient condition, daily and urgent updates, as necessary.
* Assists clinicians in coordinating the transfer and discharge of patients from agency services as indicated by the physician.
* Receives report from field clinicians prior to scheduled days off on patient status and ongoing needs.
* Processes new orders and updates the visit frequency, as appropriate, when the oncall RN takes supplemental verbal orders which alter frequency going forward.
* Writes and processes orders when taking verbal orders directly from the physician and communicates such to field clinicians.
* Assures payer change documentation is completed properly and timely, as required.
* Reviews clinician visit notes weekly to ensure timely, complete, appropriate, and accurate submission of all documentation by field staff. Takes necessary action to correct adverse findings and communicates trending to clinical director.
* Reviews, evaluates, and supervises service delivery to ensure appropriateness of care and utilization of services, equipment, and supplies through activities such as random patient visits, medical record reviews and case conferences.
* Enters infections and incidents/occurrences into the online Risk Management Incident Reporting System, as specified by policy.
* Assists in the orientation of new agency personnel.
* Provides direction and leadership to clinical team members in collaboration with the clinical director.
* Provides direct patient care, as necessary, in accordance to scope of practice and physician orders.
* Participates in QAPI program.
* Assures compliance with and ensures timely follow up on daily clinical and coding edits.
* Directs clinicians in utilizing best practice interventions when finalizing Plan of Care for all patients.
* Participates in on-call rotation.
* Follows-up with On-Call events daily.
* Receives report from weekend and after-hours clinicians admitting new patients.
* Completes LHC required learning courses, additional assignments per Executive Director request, as well as any state specific required training per state regulation/practice act requirements.
* Directs team in adherence to and participates in the Episode Management process.
* All other duties as assigned.

  

Education & Experience


* Current RN licensure in state of practice
* Current CPR certification required
* Current Driver's License, vehicle insurance, and access to a dependable vehicle or public transportation
company_description: It's all about helping people. LHC Group, Inc. is a national provider of in-home healthcare services and innovations for communities around the nation, offering quality, value-based healthcare.

title: Head of Wealth Management Data Engineering and Analytics
description:
**HEAD OF WEALTH MANAGEMENT, DATA ENGINEERING AND ANALYTICS**

**WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?**


The ideal candidate for the Head of Wealth Management (WM), Data Engineering and Analytics role will be a seasoned professional with a strong background in both data engineering and analytics, particularly within the financial services sector. They will possess extensive experience in designing and implementing data strategies, leveraging advanced analytics techniques to drive business insights and innovation.




**What you will do**


As the Head of Wealth Management Data Engineering and Analytics, your role is to lead the creation and implementation of data strategies and solutions that provide business insights and bolster the wealth management division. Your primary responsibilities will include:

* Developing and executing a comprehensive data engineering and analytics strategy that is in line with the business goals of the entertainment banking, private banking and wealth management division. You will ensure that data initiatives foster growth, enhance client satisfaction, and improve operational efficiency.
* Supervising the design, development, and ongoing maintenance of a scalable and robust data infrastructure. You will guarantee that the data architecture, data warehousing, and data pipelines adhere to the highest standards of performance, reliability, and security.
* Guiding the development and implementation of advanced analytics solutions, such as predictive and prescriptive analytics, to produce actionable insights. You will promote data-driven decision-making within the entertainment banking, private banking, and wealth management division.
* Building, leading, and mentoring a top-tier team of data engineers, data scientists, and analysts. You will cultivate a culture of collaboration, innovation, and ongoing enhancement. You will align the team with the strategic objectives of the organization.
* Collaborating closely with senior executives, business leaders, and other essential stakeholders to comprehend their data requirements and convert them into effective data solutions. You will ensure clear and consistent communication for aligned and successful project execution.
* Implementing and upholding data governance policies and procedures to guarantee data precision, uniformity, and security. You will ensure adherence to regulatory mandates and industry benchmarks.
* Keeping abreast of new data technologies and industry developments. You will lead the integration of innovative data solutions and new technologies to advance data capabilities and business results.
* Creating and tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to assess the effectiveness of data initiatives
* Align CNB's Enterprise Data Governance with RBC's evolving policies and procedures, and appropriate regulatory guidance.
* Evolve and align various data-management standards, processes and procedures within CNB towards a set of common goals and objectives aligned with the technology strategy.
* Establish centralized data quality metrics and enforcement and perform a comprehensive assessment of data needs and quality across the organization that aligns with data governance best practices.
* Define and develop artifacts outlining data dictionaries, definitions, flows and lineage across various systems and business processes across the enterprise, and aligned with RBC's data governance strategy where appropriate.
* Identify opportunities and work with business stakeholders and partners to embed data management best practices into the daily operations and business processes across the enterprise.
* Articulate the value of information in enabling business success, serve as a champion for data as a corporate asset, drive cultural change, and drive development and execution of business vision, and develop the banks data governance program.
* Responsible and accountable for appropriate quality controls related to the financial products the bank provides, the services the bank delivers, the processes employed and the incentives with which colleagues are awarded.
* All City National products, financial solutions and services are to be provided ethically and with integrity in a manner that is consistent with the client-first culture and values embodied in City National's PRIDE statement.


In this role, you will play a critical role in shaping the data strategy and execution within the wealth management division. Your leadership will ensure that data initiatives support the business objectives, enhance client experiences, and drive innovative solutions that maintain our competitive edge in the market.




**Must-Have\\***

* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
* Minimum 10 years of experience in Data Management Practices and Processes
* Minimum 5 years of experience in Data Governance practice
* Minimum 5 years of experience with People and Change Management
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in a leadership role at a large financial institution

 **Skills and Knowledge**

* Proven experience (15+ years) in data engineering, data science, and analytics roles within the financial services industry, particularly in wealth management.
* Deep knowledge of data architecture, data warehousing, data pipelines, and advanced analytics.
* Proficiency in big data technologies, cloud computing, machine learning, and AI.
* Strong leadership skills with experience in building, leading, and mentoring high-performing data engineering and analytics teams.
* Ability to foster a collaborative, innovative, and results-oriented culture.
* Ability to develop and execute a strategic data roadmap that aligns with business objectives and drives data-driven decision-making.
* Expertise in developing and deploying advanced analytics solutions, including predictive and prescriptive analytics.
* Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on generating actionable insights.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with senior executives, business leaders, and other key stakeholders.
* Ability to understand and translate business needs into effective data solutions.
* Comprehensive understanding of data governance principles, regulatory requirements, and industry standards.
* Experience in establishing and enforcing data governance policies and procedures.
* Ability to stay informed about emerging data technologies and industry trends.
* Commitment to driving innovation and continuous improvement in data capabilities.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field. An advanced degree (Masters/Ph.D.) is preferred.
* Deep understanding of the needs and expectations of wealth management clients.
* Commitment to delivering exceptional client experiences through data solutions.
* **Technology Expertise:**
+ Proficiency in data engineering technologies and tools, including MDM, data warehousing, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data integration platforms.
+ Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka, and cloud-based data platforms such as Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, or Azure Synapse Analytics.
+ Familiarity with data governance and data quality practices, ensuring that data assets are managed securely and effectively.

 **Domain Expertise:**

+ In-depth knowledge of financial data sources and datasets, including market data, customer transaction data, and regulatory reporting data.
+ Understanding of financial modeling techniques and methodologies, including risk modeling, portfolio optimization, and fraud detection.
+ Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards in the financial industry, ensuring that data initiatives adhere to relevant regulations.

**Leadership and Strategic Skills:**

* Strong leadership abilities, capable of leading a team of data engineers and analysts to develop and implement data-driven solutions that meet business objectives.
* Proven track record of leveraging advanced analytics techniques (such as machine learning, predictive modeling, and natural language processing) to derive actionable insights and drive business value.
* Strategic thinker, able to align data initiatives with strategic business goals and anticipate future data needs and trends.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into business terms and effectively communicate data insights to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.




The ideal candidate will bring a blend of technology expertise and domain knowledge to the role, enabling them to lead the development and implementation of data strategies that drive innovation and growth within the financial services industry.

**Compensation**


Starting base salary: $141,830 - $263,408 per year. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. This job is eligible for bonus and/or commissions.

* **To be considered for this position you must meet at least these basic qualifications**


The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.


**Benefits and Perks**


At City National, we strive to be the best at whatever we do, including the benefits and perks we offer our colleagues. Get an inside look at our Benefits and Perks.




**INCLUSION AND EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT**  

City National Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.'




**ABOUT CITY NATIONAL**


We start with a basic premise: Business is personal. Since day one we've always gone further than the competition to help our clients, colleagues and community flourish. City National Bank was founded in 1954 by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs and that legacy of integrity, community and unparalleled client relationships continues to drive phenomenal growth today. City National is a subsidiary of Royal Bank of Canada, one of North America's leading diversified financial services companies.




#CA-AP


#LI-AP

title: Registration Manager
description:
**About Us:**


At BCD Meetings & Events (BCD M&E), we provide more than meeting and event planning services: we create connections that inspire, motivate and change behavior for our customers. As the world’s most trusted and innovative meetings and events agency, BCD M&E cultivates a culture of people, passion and purpose to drive business forward.

  

Headquartered in Chicago, with locations in 50+ countries across the world, BCD M&E’s team of 1,800+ people are committed to sustainability and driving success for our customers, our business and ourselves. Our values are at the heart of everything we do, and we look for people that want to be a part of something special, can rise to our standards and love to bring their unique perspective to the table.

  

While we can’t guarantee every day will be the best (who can?), we can promise a community of people who genuinely care and lead with empathy, a flexible workplace with awesome perks and challenging work that means something.

  

See what life is about at BCD M&E at bcdme.com/careers

 **About the role:**  

Do you have experience in online event registration management? Large housing block management? Cvent event management? Any or all of the above? Become part of the BCD Meetings & Events team!

  



We’re looking for outgoing professional who has experience in event logistics planning and/or execution to join our dynamic team dedicated to supporting events for a Life Sciences client. Advanced Excel skills are a must, Cvent event management is a big plus… but we can train.

  

As part of a high touch team, you will identify and optimize online registration process and strategies. We are looking for a confident and effective collaborator, communicator and who strives in a high paced, multi-project environment. You will work on all types of in-person and virtual events.

  

Large internal events, meetings and programs of 100 – 600+ attendees in size. Travel as well as out of normal business hours working will be required, supporting some of our clients highest profile events.

  

Our culture is teamwork and collaboration for successful delivery. We are looking for individuals who embody and naturally promote that mindset

 **As a Registration Manager you will:**

* Lead the online registration process for assigned events ensuring data integrity and reporting using event technology databases and Excel
* Handle attendee inquires via phone and email
* Be a proactive, engaged and collaborative member of the assigned event team
* Create a seamless attendee experience for everyone the programs assigned support

 **You’re good at**

* Learning and optimizing the optimal attendee online registration experience
* Using event technology tools and Excel
* Collaborative, big picture and inclusive problem solving
* Communicating… both in writing and verbal, with a variety of communication styles and can embrace ideas and opinions different that your own
* Ability to see around corners, pre-empt and pre plan for every eventuality.
* Attention to detail. Our client produces perfect products. They expect the same of our team· Cvent hands on registration and reporting experience
* Cvent hands on registration and reporting experience

 **You might also have**

* Degree in Hospitality

 **You should know:**

* This role is hybrid in Ridgefield, CT.

 **How to apply:**  

Click ‘Apply Now’ to be considered.

 **THE PERKS**

 **Flexible Working**  

We believe that a flexible working environment is key to getting the best out of our teams. We will support you to work where you need to and when you need to, depending on how you work best.

 **Room to Grow**  

Our line of work and business structure challenge our people in a way that inspires growth, with learning and development built into every role. We give individuals ownership over the direction and speed in which they grow.

 **Everyone has a voice**  

We thrive on conversations that spark curiosity and empathy. No matter how big or how small, every voice is heard, considered and respected.

 **Make your move**  

The diversity of roles across BCD M&E’s global locations means that our people often find new adventures during their time with us. Join us as a meeting planner role in the UK, stay for a global marketing career — there’s always room to move.

 **We’ve got you covered**  

Our extensive benefits include comprehensive healthcare, retirement plans, continued education support, diverse work locations, travel and hotel discounts, volunteer and sustainability opportunities and a successful employee recognition program.

 **We’re positive. You’ll love it.**  

It starts from the top. Our leaders lead with positivity, believe in our people and trust us to do the right thing. There will always be support along your journey, in little and big ways.

 *We carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors, including your professional background and experience. The salary range for candidates in applicable jurisdictions in the US for the position of* *Registration Manager* *is between $45,000 - $62,500* *The actual pay depends on your skills, qualifications, experience, geographical location, and project budget**.*

  

#LI-JV1


#LI-LZ1  

#LI-KW1


#LI-Hybrid


#LI-Onsite
company_description: Join a globally connected workplace and grow your career with BCD Travel and BCD Meetings & Events. We are committed to becoming the world’s most trusted, innovative, and sustainable travel management
